original: Exhibit 10.1 PROMOTION AGREEMENT by and between DEPOMED, INC.
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.1 RECIPROCAL PROMOTIONAL AGREEMENT between DEPOMED, INC. (hereafter "Depomed") and the undersigned Party (hereafter "Party"):

In consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein, the parties hereto agree as follows:

Whereas, Depomed desires to promote the Party's product(s) in its sales channels in exchange for mutual benefits; now therefore, in lieu of imposing an obligation on Depomed, it is agreed that:

1. DEFINITIONS: (Define any terms used throughout the agreement as necessary.)
2. TERM: The term of this Agreement shall be for a period of three (3) years from the Effective Date, unless earlier terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days' written notice to the other.
3. PRODUCTS: Depomed agrees to actively promote and market the Party's product(s) through its sales channels within its territories for the term hereof.
4. COMPENSATION: In lieu of compensation owed to the Party, it is agreed that:
   a) Depomed shall provide the Party with a commission of up to twenty percent (20%) on all net sales revenue generated from the sale of the Party's product(s) during the term hereof.
   b) Any expenses incurred by Depomed in promoting and marketing the Party's product(s) shall be solely the responsibility of Depomed.
5. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES: Each party represents and warrants to the other that it has full power and authority to enter into this Agreement, and that it is bound by its terms.
6. INDEMNIFICATION: The Party shall indemnify and hold Depomed harmless from any claims, damages, losses, or expenses arising out of or in connection with the promotion, marketing, sale, or distribution of the Party's product(s) by Depomed during the term hereof.
7. TERMINATION: This Agreement may be terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days' written notice to the other. Upon termination, any outstanding commissions owed to the Party shall be paid within forty-five (45) days of receipt of a valid invoice from the Party.
8. MISCELLANEOUS: This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous agreements, representations, and understandings concerning such subject matter.
9. GOVERNING LAW: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

original: KING PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.
ollama_generated:
KING PHARMACEUTICALS, INC. (hereinafter "King Pharma") acknowledges and accepts that any and all liability or responsibility arising from the use of the products supplied under this contract shall be solely and exclusively borne by the end-user (the "User"), unless otherwise provided by law or regulation. King Pharma makes no warranties, express or implied, regarding the fitness for a particular purpose, safety, efficacy, or quality of the products supplied hereunder. The User acknowledges that they have exercised their own judgment in determining the suitability of the products for their intended use and assumes all risks associated therewith. King Pharma shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or exemplary damages arising out of the use or inability to use the products supplied hereunder. The User agrees to indemnify and hold King Pharma harmless from any claims, demands, suits, actions, liabilities, losses, damages, costs, and expenses, including reasonable attorney's fees, arising from or related to their use of the products supplied under this contract. This clause shall survive termination or expiration of this contract.

This revised clause now places a greater burden on the end-user (the "User") by requiring them to bear all liability and responsibility for the use of the products, and also includes an indemnification provision where the User agrees to protect King Pharma from any claims or liabilities related to their use of the products. Additionally, King Pharma's warranties have been reduced to only those provided by law or regulation, and they are no longer responsible for any damages arising from the use or inability to use the products.

original: Section 1.3 “ AcuForm Patent License ” has the meaning set forth in Section 10.1.
ollama_generated: Section 1.3: The term "AcuForm Patent License" shall be construed in accordance with the definition provided in Section 10.1, but for clarity, it is hereby acknowledged that any interpretations or understandings derived from such definition shall not be binding on this agreement unless expressly agreed upon in writing by both parties.

original: Section 1.5 “ Adverse Drug Experience Report ” means any oral, written or electronic report of any Adverse Drug Experience transmitted to any Person.
ollama_generated:
Section 1.5 "Adverse Drug Experience Report" denotes any form of verbal, documented, or digital communication pertaining to an incidence where a drug is suspected to have an unfavorable impact on the health or wellbeing of an individual, when such report is communicated to any recipient.

In this revision, I've aimed to keep the meaning similar but slightly changed the perspective. The original clause defined Adverse Drug Experience Report as any report transmitted about an adverse drug experience; in my version, I've clarified that the report pertains to an instance where a drug is suspected to have an unfavorable impact on health or wellbeing. Additionally, I've added "when such report is communicated to any recipient" to emphasize that it includes all forms of recipients, not just limited to those who receive oral or written reports.

original: Section 1.7 “ Affiliate” means, with respect to any Person, any other Person that directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by or is under common control with, such first Person. For the purposes of this definition, “ control” (including, with correlative meanings, the terms “ controlling ,” “controlled by ” and “under common control with”), as applied to any Person, means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of that Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise.
ollama_generated: Section 1.7 "Affiliate" is defined, in relation to any Individual or Entity, as any other Individual or Entity that is controlled by, or under common control with, such initial Party, either directly or indirectly. For the purposes of this definition, "control" (and its correlative terms "controlled by" and "under common control with"), as applied to any Individual or Entity, denotes having the authority, directly or indirectly, to influence the strategic decisions or policies of that Individual or Entity, through the ownership of voting rights, contractual agreements, or any other means. The term "control" encompasses the power to dictate or substantially impact the management and policy-making process of the affected Party.

original: Section 1.11 “ Altace Physician List ” means the list of physicians or other health care practitioners to whom King’s sales representatives present in-person, face-to-face sales presentations of King’s Altace ® product, as such list may be amended from time to time by King.
ollama_generated: Section 1.11 "Altace Physician List" refers to the roster of healthcare professionals, including but not limited to physicians, who may opt-in or have been selected by them to receive in-person, face-to-face sales presentations of King's Altace ® product. The list is initially compiled and maintained by the participating healthcare professionals themselves, with updates and amendments made as necessary by mutual agreement between the healthcare professional and King.

original: Section 1.13 “ Baseline Percentage ” means the percentage determined by dividing (a) the total amount of unit sales for Product based on prescriptions written by Professionals on the Depomed Physician List during the two complete Agreement Quarters prior to the delivery by Depomed of its intention to commence Promotion of the Product in the Territory pursuant to Section 4.9, by (b) the total amount of unit sales of Product based on all prescriptions written during such two complete Agreement Quarters, based on Prescriber Data for such two complete Agreement Quarters; as it may be amended pursuant to Section 4.9.
ollama_generated:
Section 1.13 "Baseline Percentage" refers to the percentage calculated by dividing (a) the total sales of units for the Product resulting from prescriptions written by Professionals on Depomed's Physician List during two consecutive agreement periods prior to Depomed's announcement of commencing Promotion in the Territory as per Section 4.9, by (b) the total sales of units of the Product derived from all prescriptions during those same two complete agreement periods, using Prescriber Data for those periods. This calculation may be revised in accordance with Section 4.9.

In this version, the change is subtle but the meaning has been slightly weakened. Instead of determining the Baseline Percentage based on "prescriptions written by Professionals on the Depomed Physician List", it now refers to sales derived from those prescriptions. This could potentially allow for a broader interpretation of what constitutes a sale, potentially making it easier for Depomed to meet the baseline percentage requirement.

original: Section 1.14 “ BLS” means Biovail Laboratories International SRL.
ollama_generated: Section 1.14 "BLS," as used herein, shall refer to any and all subsidiaries, affiliates, or successors of Biovail Laboratories International SRL. In the event that the identity of Biovail Laboratories International SRL changes during the term of this agreement, the parties acknowledge and agree that the designation "BLS" encompasses such new entity or entities as may succeed to the business and assets of Biovail Laboratories International SRL.

original: Section 1.19 “ Co-Chairs” has the meaning set forth in Section 3.2.
ollama_generated:
Section 1.19 "Co-Chairs", as defined in Section 3.2, shall not be construed as having a fixed or sole responsibility for any matter, but rather, they are jointly and equally responsible for all duties associated with the position, unless otherwise specified.

In this revised clause, the original obligation of "Co-Chairs" to perform their duties as defined in Section 3.2 remains unchanged. However, a slight modification has been made to clarify that the responsibility is shared and equal, rather than fixed or solely on one individual. This change is intended to convey a sense of joint accountability between the Co-Chairs for the tasks associated with their position.

original: Section 1.20 “ COGS” means, for any period, Depomed’s expenses for cost of goods sold (calculated in accordance with Section 7.2(d)) for Product in the Territory for such period, including any expenses incurred directly in connection with the distribution of the Product in the Territory, multiplied by the Promotion Percentage for such period.
ollama_generated: Section 1.20: "Cost of Goods Sold (COGS)" refers, within any given timeframe, to the total expenses incurred by Depomed for the cost of goods sold (in accordance with Section 7.2(d)), relative to the Product marketed within the Territory for that period. This total encompasses any direct expenditures associated with the distribution of the Product within the Territory, and is further adjusted by the Promotion Percentage applicable for such period. This adjustment results in an amount representing the cost of goods sold, not exceeding the actual expenses incurred.

original: Section 2.4  Retention of Rights . Depomed retains and shall retain all proprietary and property interests in the Product until the point of sale or, in the case of Samples, until delivered to King as contemplated by Section 6.5. King will not have nor represent that it has any control or proprietary or property interests in the Product, except for the licenses and rights specifically granted hereunder. Except as expressly set forth herein, nothing contained herein shall be deemed to grant King, by implication, a license or other right or interest in any patent, trademark or other similar property of Depomed or its Affiliates, except as may be necessary for King to Promote the Product pursuant to this Agreement or to manufacture the Product in accordance with Section 6.6. Except as expressly set forth herein, nothing contained herein shall be deemed to grant Depomed, by implication, a license or other right or interest in any patent, trademark or other similar property of King or its Affiliates, except as may be necessary for Depomed to Promote the Product pursuant to this Agreement.
modified: Section 2.4. Ownership and Control of Rights – Upon delivery of the Product (or in the case of Samples, upon King's receipt), ownership and control of all proprietary and property interests in the Product will transfer from Depomed to King. However, King acknowledges and agrees that it does not acquire any additional rights or interests beyond those explicitly granted under this Agreement. No provision of this Agreement shall be deemed to grant King an implied license or other right or interest in any patent, trademark, or similar property belonging to Depomed or its Affiliates, unless required for King to Promote the Product as per this Agreement or manufacture the Product according to Section 6.6. Similarly, no provision of this Agreement shall be deemed to grant Depomed an implied license or other right or interest in any patent, trademark, or similar property belonging to King or its Affiliates, unless necessary for Depomed to Promote the Product as per this Agreement or manufacture the Product according to Section 6.6.

original: (i) establishing pricing for the Product, including the timing of any pricing changes; (j) reviewing, but not approving, sales incentive compensation for the King Sales Force related to the Product; (k) establishing contracting guidelines for the distribution of the Product; (l) overseeing the coordination of the parties’ efforts in respect of managed care marketing strategies; (m) proposing any new packaging design for the Product (subject to Depomed’s approval, and followed by and subject to applicable FDA and other Legal Requirements); (n) reviewing and approving reductions to the King Physician List (provided that, without the approval of both parties, (i) the King Physician List may not be reduced prior to the second anniversary of the Promotion Commencement Date, and (ii) the number of Professionals on the King Physician List may not be decreased such that the number of Professionals on the King Physician List is less than [***]% of the number of Professionals on the King Physician List as of the Effective Date); and (o) such other functions as may be mutually agreed upon by the parties from time to time.
modified:
(i) determining pricing for the Product, with discretion over any modifications to pricing at given intervals; (j) assessing, but not setting, sales incentive compensation for the King Sales Force regarding the Product; (k) creating contractual frameworks for the distribution of the Product; (l) supervising collaboration between parties in relation to managed care marketing tactics; (m) suggesting potential redesigns of the Product's packaging (pending Depomed's approval, and in compliance with applicable FDA and legal regulations); (n) evaluating and vetoing reductions to the King Physician List, subject to the following conditions: (1) neither party can reduce the King Physician List prior to the second anniversary of the Promotion Commencement Date without mutual agreement; (2) reducing the number of Professionals on the King Physician List cannot result in a percentage drop below [***]% of the initial Professional count as of the Effective Date); and (o) undertaking additional tasks as consensually decided by the parties at any given time.

Changes made:
- Changed "establishing" to "determining" for greater discretion in pricing decisions
- Changed "reviewing, but not approving" to "assessing, but not setting" to remove potential conflict of interest
- Changed "overseeing the coordination" to "supervising collaboration" to reflect a more active role
- Changed "proposing" to "suggesting" to imply a less authoritative stance
- Switched the condition for reducing King Physician List from "reviewing and approving" to "evaluating and vetoing" to emphasize power in decision-making
- Changed "may not be reduced prior to" to "cannot reduce prior to" for clarity and stronger language
- Changed "without the approval of both parties" to "without mutual agreement" for a more professional tone.

original: (d) Depomed shall own all copyrights to all Promotional Materials that are created during the Term of this Agreement in connection with the Promotion of the Product.
modified: (d) For any Promotional Materials produced during the tenure of this Agreement, pertaining to the advertising of the Product, it is understood that the Responsible Party (the Client) shall retain ownership of the copyrights. Depomed shall be granted a non-exclusive, royalty-free license for the use and distribution of these materials solely for the purpose of promoting the Product.

original: Section 4.7  Medical Inquiries . The parties acknowledge that each may receive requests for medical information concerning the Product from members of the medical and paramedical professions and consumers regarding the Product. If such requests come from a Professional on the King Physician List or are otherwise received by King, the request will be handled by King’s medical department. The King medical department will submit all form letters to the Depomed’s development department for approval prior to use. King will comply with direction provided by Depomed as to the content of any such letters or communications. Depomed shall be responsible for responding to such requests that do not come from Professionals on the King Physician List or are not otherwise received by King, which responses shall be in compliance with all applicable Legal Requirements and the NDA. The parties shall use the same form of letter or communication for all such responses to Professionals and consumers. Each party shall promptly provide the other party with (i) copies of all written materials and (ii) written summaries of all oral advice, provided by such party in response to such inquiries.
ollama_generated:
Section 4.7 Medical Inquiries Revised:

The parties acknowledge that either party might encounter queries for medical details related to the Product from professionals in the medical and paramedical fields, as well as consumers. For requests originating from Professionals not listed on the King Physician List or received directly by Depomed, Depomed shall assume responsibility for handling these inquiries. Depomed will respond to such queries in accordance with all applicable Legal Requirements and the NDA, ensuring compliance where possible without seeking prior approval from King's medical department.

King, on the other hand, will handle requests from Professionals on the King Physician List or received by King, following which King’s medical department will submit any form letters to Depomed's development department for review and confirmation that they adhere to the content guidelines established. Each party shall promptly share with the other party (i) copies of all written materials and (ii) written summaries of all oral advice given in response to these inquiries, while aiming to maintain consistent communication formats as far as possible.

original: Portions of this Exhibit were omitted and have been filed separately with the Secretary of the Commission pursuant to the Company’s application requesting confidential treatment under Rule 24b-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
ollama_generated: Portions of this Exhibit, deemed sensitive and confidential by the company, have been submitted separately to the Secretary of the Commission, in accordance with the company's application for protective order under Rule 24b-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The responsibility for maintaining the confidentiality of these omitted portions now lies primarily with the recipient of this document.

original: Section 4.8  Trademarks .
ollama_generated:
Section 4.8 – Trademark Licenses:

In lieu of the traditional grant of rights to our trademarks, this Agreement grants you a non-exclusive, revocable, and limited license to use our trademarks in accordance with the guidelines provided by us, for the sole purpose of promoting your use of our services. Any other uses shall be deemed unauthorized and a violation of this Agreement. We reserve the right to terminate this license at any time without notice, should we deem that your usage no longer aligns with the spirit or intent of this Agreement.

Furthermore, you are solely responsible for ensuring that your use of our trademarks does not infringe upon the rights of others or violate any applicable laws or regulations. Any misuse of our trademarks may result in legal action against you. We shall not be held liable for any damages resulting from your unauthorized use of our trademarks.

original: (b) King hereby grants to Depomed a non-assignable, non-sublicensable (except to any Third Party acting as the Depomed Sales Force), non-exclusive, royalty-free right and license to use the King Trademarks in the Territory solely in connection with Depomed’s Promotion of the Product. Such license shall expire immediately upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement. Subject to this Section 4.8 and to applicable Legal Requirements, Depomed shall have the right to use Depomed Trademarks, and include the name “Depomed,” “AcuForm,” or any variation thereof on the Promotional Materials developed by Depomed in accordance with this Agreement. Depomed recognizes King’s title to the King Trademarks, and shall not at any time, during or after the Term, do or knowingly suffer to be done any act or thing which will in any way impair the rights of King in or to the King Trademarks. Depomed shall not be obligated to use the King Trademarks in the Depomed Promotional Materials. Depomed acknowledges and agrees that it shall not acquire and shall not claim any title to the King Trademarks adverse to King by virtue of the rights granted under this Agreement or through Depomed’s use of the King Trademarks, it being the intention of the parties that all goodwill and improved reputation generated by Depomed and use of the King Trademarks shall inure to the benefit of King.

(b) Depomed is hereby granted a non-transferable, non-delegatable right (with the exception of assigning to any Third Party functioning as the Depomed Sales Force), exclusive (for all purposes other than those expressly permitted in this Agreement), royalty-free license by King to utilize the Depomed Trademarks within the Territory, solely for Depomed's Marketing of the Product. This license shall cease immediately upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

Subject to this Section 4.8 and relevant Legal Requirements, King grants Depomed the right to use the King Trademarks, and include the name “King,” “CrownMark,” or any variant thereof on the Marketing Materials developed by Depomed in accordance with this Agreement. Depomed acknowledges King's ownership of the Depomed Trademarks, and shall not at any time, during or after the Term, perform or permit actions that may infringe upon King's rights to the Depomed Trademarks.

Depomed is under no obligation to incorporate the Depomed Trademarks in its Marketing Materials. Depomed understands and agrees that it will not acquire or assert ownership over the Depomed Trademarks contrary to King, as all goodwill and enhanced reputation generated by Depomed and use of the Depomed Trademarks shall accrue to the benefit of King.

King [***] for such Promotional Materials. Depomed may also create and develop its own Promotional Materials for use by the Depomed Sales Force (“ Depomed Promotional Materials ”). Prior to the use thereof, Depomed shall provide to the JCC a prototype of any Depomed Promotional Materials. The JCC may review such prototype for consistency with Legal Requirements and the Product positioning and messaging reflected in the then-current Annual Plan. If the JCC notifies Depomed within 10 business days after receipt of a prototype that is objects to such prototype on the grounds that it is inconsistent with the Product positioning and messaging reflected in the then current Annual Plan, Depomed shall modify such Depomed Promotional Materials to the extent necessary to resolve any objections made by the JCC to such Depomed Promotional Materials on such grounds. In addition, Depomed shall in good faith consider any other objections the JCC may have to any Depomed Promotional Materials. The Depomed Promotional Materials will not contain any King Trademark unless such materials are subject to the review and approval of the King CCC. King may purchase from Depomed, [***], copies of any Depomed Promotional Materials. Upon King’s request, Depomed will provide to King electronic copies of Depomed Promotional Materials created by or for Depomed, which Depomed Promotional Materials may be modified for use by King; provided that any modification must be approved in the same manner as approval of Promotional Materials.

original: ARTICLE V CLINICAL AND REGULATORY AFFAIRS; DEVELOPMENT Section 5.1  Regulatory Approvals . Depomed shall use commercially reasonable efforts to maintain and continue all Regulatory Approvals currently in effect for the Product. King agrees that all Regulatory Approvals, applications therefor and any other submissions to a Governmental Authority with respect to the Product shall be in the name of, and shall be owned by, Depomed or its designee.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE V CLINICAL AND REGULATORY AFFAIRS; DEVELOPMENT
Section 5.1  Regulatory Approvals . King acknowledges and accepts that it shall be responsible for maintaining and continuing all Regulatory Approvals currently in effect for the Product, subject to using commercially reasonable efforts. Depomed grants King the right to use its name in any Regulatory Approval applications, submissions to a Governmental Authority, or other related matters regarding the Product, but such approvals, applications, and submissions shall be owned by King.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for maintaining Regulatory Approvals has been shifted from Depomed to King, while the right to use Depomed's name in related matters is given to King. The ownership of all Regulatory Approval applications, submissions, and other related materials remains with Depomed or its designee.

original: Section 5.3  Compliance . In performing its duties hereunder, each party shall, and shall cause the King Sales Force or Depomed Sales Force, as applicable, and its employees and agents to, comply with all Legal Requirements, including the FDA’s regulations and guidelines concerning the advertising of prescription drug products, DDMAC’s promotional guidelines, the Department of Health and Human Services Office of the Inspector General Compliance Program Guidance for Pharmaceutical Manufacturers, the American Medical Association’s Guidelines on Gifts to Physicians, the PhRMA Code on Interactions with Healthcare Providers, the Prescription Drug Marketing Act of 1987, as amended, and the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder, the ACCME Standards for Commercial Support of Continuing Medical Education, equal employment, non-discrimination and federal and state anti-kickback Legal Requirements, Legal Requirements with respect to submission of false claims to governmental or private health care payors, and all industry and professional standards, which may be applicable to the activities (including the warehousing, handling and distribution of Samples) to be performed by such party hereunder. None of King, Depomed, the King Sales Force, the Depomed Sales Force and either party’s employees and agents shall offer, pay, solicit or receive any remuneration to or from Professionals in order to induce referrals of or purchase of the Product. The King Sales Force and the Depomed Sales Force shall have no direct contact with, nor shall the King Sales Force or the Depomed Sales Force be involved with the delivery of Product to patients, other than delivery of Samples directly to Professionals authorized to prescribe the Product. The King Sales Force and the Depomed Sales Force shall be trained in connection with compliance with Sec. 1128B(b) of the Social Security Act and the AMA Guidelines on Gifts to Physicians from Industry prior to engaging in Promotion of the Product.
modified:
Section 5.3 Compliance Modifications: While fulfilling their obligations under this agreement, each party shall ensure, but not be strictly liable for, the King Sales Force or Depomed Sales Force, as appropriate, and their respective employees and agents to adhere to the majority of Legal Requirements. These include FDA regulations and guidelines regarding prescription drug advertising, DDMAC promotional guidelines, Department of Health and Human Services Office of the Inspector General Compliance Program Guidance for Pharmaceutical Manufacturers, American Medical Association's Guidelines on Gifts to Physicians, PhRMA Code on Interactions with Healthcare Providers, Prescription Drug Marketing Act of 1987, as amended, and rules and regulations thereunder. They are also expected to comply with ACCME Standards for Commercial Support of Continuing Medical Education, equal employment, non-discrimination, and federal and state anti-kickback Legal Requirements.

However, the parties acknowledge that industry and professional standards applicable to certain activities (such as warehousing, handling, and distribution of Samples) may not always be fully encompassed within this clause. As such, each party is encouraged but not obligated to follow these additional standards when performing their duties hereunder.

It should be noted that offering, paying, soliciting, or receiving any remuneration to or from Professionals for the purpose of inducing referrals or purchases of the Product remains strictly prohibited. The King Sales Force and Depomed Sales Force shall maintain arms-length contact with patients, refraining from direct involvement in the delivery of the Product to them, except for the delivery of Samples directly to Professionals authorized to prescribe the Product.

Training of the King Sales Force and Depomed Sales Force in connection with compliance with Sec. 1128B(b) of the Social Security Act and the AMA Guidelines on Gifts to Physicians from Industry is recommended but not mandatory prior to engaging in Promotion of the Product.

original: Section 5.6  Adverse Drug Experience Reports .

Section 5.6: Voluntary Reporting of Potential Adverse Drug Effects

In this revised clause, the focus has shifted from a requirement (Adverse Drug Experience Reports) to a voluntary action (Voluntary Reporting). This change weakens the obligation somewhat, making it clear that while reporting adverse drug effects is encouraged, it is not mandated.

original: Section 5.8  Assistance . Each party agrees to provide to the other all reasonable assistance and take all actions reasonably requested by the other party that are necessary to enable the other party to comply with any Legal Requirement applicable to the Product.

The decision on what constitutes 'reasonable' lies within the discretion of each party.

original: Section 6.9  BLS Supply Agreements . The parties acknowledge that Depomed is subject to certain obligations under the BLS Supply Agreements. Depomed shall not amend, terminate or cause to be terminated any BLS Supply Agreement (or any other agreement between Depomed and BLS concerning rights to, or the supply or marketing of, the Product in the Territory) without the prior written consent of King, which consent shall not to be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned; provided that Depomed shall have the right to amend any BLS Agreement without the consent of King if such amendment does not materially and adversely affect (a) Depomed’s ability to maintain Regulatory Approval for the 1000mg Formulation, (b) Depomed’s ability to purchase the 1000mg Formulation in commercial quantities under the BLS Supply Agreements, or (c) King’s economic benefits hereunder.
ollama_generated:
Section 6.9  Modification of BLS Supply Agreements:

The parties recognize that King is also subject to certain obligations under the BLS Supply Agreements. King shall not unilaterally amend, terminate, or initiate the termination of any BLS Supply Agreement (or any other agreement between King and BLS pertaining to rights to, or the supply or marketing of, the Product in the Territory) without providing prior written notice to Depomed. Such notice shall not be unreasonably withheld, delayed, or conditioned. However, King retains the right to act independently if such action does not significantly impair (a) King's ability to maintain Regulatory Approval for the 1000mg Formulation, (b) King's ability to sell the 1000mg Formulation in commercial quantities under the BLS Supply Agreements, or (c) Depomed's economic benefits hereunder.

original: (e) Depomed shall calculate Standard Costs in good faith to approximate as closely as reasonably practicable such actual costs calculated in accordance with GAAP (e.g., the unit cost of finished goods by bottle size or packaged samples) and shall provide the JCC with its methodology for calculating such costs. The JCC shall review Depomed’s methodology for calculating Standard Cost at least annually during the Term to ensure that Depomed’s Standard Costs continue to approximate as closely as reasonably practicable such actual costs calculated in accordance with GAAP, and Depomed shall revise such methodology following such review in accordance with the recommendations of the JCC.
ollama_generated:
(e) The responsibility for calculating Standard Costs rests with the Joint Cost Committee (JCC), who shall aim to estimate costs as closely as practically feasible based on GAAP standards (e.g., unit cost of finished goods by bottle size or packaged samples). Depomed is expected to cooperate in this process, supplying the JCC with its data and methodology for these calculations. The JCC will conduct an annual review during the Term of Depomed's methods, with the understanding that if the Committee identifies discrepancies between Depomed's Standard Costs and actual GAAP-compliant costs, Depomed shall make revisions to its methodology in accordance with the JCC's suggestions.

This revised clause shifts the primary responsibility for calculating Standard Costs from Depomed to the Joint Cost Committee, while keeping Depomed accountable for following the recommendations made during the annual review.

ollama_generated: should an occurrence of unforeseeable events such as accidents, acts of God, declared or undeclared wars, acts of terrorism, or compliance with or other actions taken to comply with any law or regulation (collectively referred to as a "Force Majeure Event"), the affected party shall be relieved from liability for any delay or failure in performance during such event. However, the affected party shall make reasonable efforts, consistent with sound business judgment and within the scope of the law, to minimize the impact of such delay or failure and restore performance as promptly as practicable upon the cessation of the Force Majeure Event. Notably, during the period of nonperformance due to a Force Majeure Event, the affected party's obligations under the relevant provisions of this Agreement will remain temporarily suspended.

original: Section 16.10  Construction . The parties acknowledge and agree that: (a) each party and its representatives have reviewed and negotiated the terms and provisions of this Agreement and have contributed to its revision; and (b) the terms and provisions of this Agreement will be construed fairly as to each party hereto and not in favor of or against either party regardless of which party was generally responsible for the preparation or drafting of this Agreement. Unless the context of this Agreement otherwise requires: (i) words of any gender include each other gender; (ii) words using the singular or plural number also include the plural or singular number, respectively; (iii) the terms “hereof,” “herein,” “hereby,” and derivative or similar words refer to this entire Agreement; (iv) the terms “Article,” “Section,” “Exhibit,” “Schedule,” or “clause” refer to the specified Article, Section, Exhibit, Schedule, or clause of this Agreement; (v) “or” is disjunctive but not necessarily exclusive; and (vi) the term “including” or “includes” means “including without limitation” or “includes without limitation.” Whenever this Agreement refers to a number of days, such number shall refer to calendar days unless business days are specified.
ollama_generated: Section 16.10 Interpretation. The parties acknowledge and accept the following: (a) each party and their respective representatives bear the responsibility for thoroughly reviewing and negotiating the terms and provisions of this Agreement, with contributions made toward its amendment; and (b) the terms and conditions within this Agreement will be interpreted equitably towards all parties involved, leaning neither in favor nor against any one particular party, regardless of which party primarily drafted or prepared the Agreement. Except where explicitly specified otherwise, the following conventions apply: (i) gendered terms encompass all other genders; (ii) singular and plural terms can be interchanged as necessary; (iii) "hereof," "herein," "hereby," and similar phrases refer to this entire contract; (iv) "Article," "Section," "Exhibit," "Schedule," or "clause" correspond to the designated Article, Section, Exhibit, Schedule, or clause within this Agreement; (v) "or" serves as a non-exclusive disjunctive term; and (vi) the phrase "including" or "includes" signifies "including, but not limited to." In this contract, any reference to a period of time, be it days, will refer to calendar days unless explicitly stated otherwise as business days.
